DOC.brief_summary: Gastric banding has been shown to significantly reduce weight and has been approved as a treatment of morbid obesity. The standard laparoscopic operation requires five small incisions for the introduction of instruments and the band into the patient's abdomen. We have developed a technique for performing this operation through a single incision at the belly button. This study compares this method to the conventional 5-incision approach.
DOC.brief_title: Single Incision Laparoscopic Gastric Banding Versus Conventional Five Port Laparoscopic Gastric Banding
DOC.criteria: BMI > 40 ASA Class I or II Comorbid cardiac, pulmonary, renal, hepatic disease Bleeding disorder Previous gastric/esophageal surgery
